intro: Chionographis japonica var. koreana, commonly known as the Korean snowbell, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth texture. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes various species of bellflowers.
